title: Run scVelo workflow — RunSCVELO
code: RunSCVELO(   srt = NULL,   adata = NULL,   assay_x = "RNA",   layer_x = "counts",   assay_y = c("spliced", "unspliced"),   layer_y = "counts",   group_by = NULL,   linear_reduction = NULL,   nonlinear_reduction = NULL,   basis = NULL,   mode = "stochastic",   fitting_by = "stochastic",   magic_impute = FALSE,   knn = 5,   t = 2,   min_shared_counts = 30,   n_pcs = 30,   n_neighbors = 30,   filter_genes = TRUE,   min_counts = 3,   min_counts_u = 3,   normalize_per_cell = TRUE,   log_transform = TRUE,   use_raw = FALSE,   diff_kinetics = FALSE,   stream_smooth = NULL,   stream_density = 2,   arrow_length = 5,   arrow_size = 5,   arrow_density = 0.5,   denoise = FALSE,   denoise_topn = 3,   kinetics = FALSE,   kinetics_topn = 100,   calculate_velocity_genes = FALSE,   compute_velocity_confidence = TRUE,   compute_terminal_states = TRUE,   compute_pseudotime = TRUE,   compute_paga = TRUE,   top_n = 6,   n_jobs = 1,   palette = "Paired",   palcolor = NULL,   show_plot = TRUE,   save = FALSE,   dpi = 300,   dirpath = "./",   fileprefix = "",   return_seurat = !is.null(srt),   verbose = TRUE )

title: Run scVelo workflow — RunSCVELO
text: srt Seurat object. Default NULL. provided, adata ignored. adata anndata object. Default NULL. assay_x Assay convert anndata object. layer_x Layer name assay_x Seurat object. assay_y Assay convert anndata object. layer_y Layer names assay_y Seurat object. group_by Variable use grouping cells Seurat object. linear_reduction Linear reduction method use, e.g., "PCA". nonlinear_reduction Non-linear reduction method use, e.g., "UMAP". basis basis use reduction, e.g., "UMAP". mode Velocity estimation models use. Can vector containing "deterministic", "stochastic", /"dynamical". fitting_by Method used fit gene velocities dynamical modeling, e.g., "stochastic". magic_impute Flag indicating whether perform magic imputation. knn number nearest neighbors magic.MAGIC. t power diffusion operator powered magic.MAGIC. min_shared_counts Minimum number counts (unspliced spliced) required gene. n_pcs Number principal components (PCs) used velocity estimation. n_neighbors Number nearest neighbors used velocity estimation. filter_genes Whether filter genes based minimum counts. min_counts Minimum counts gene filtering. min_counts_u Minimum unspliced counts gene filtering. normalize_per_cell Whether normalize counts per cell. log_transform Whether apply log transformation. use_raw Whether use raw data dynamical modeling. diff_kinetics Whether use differential kinetics. stream_smooth Multiplication factor scale Gaussian kernel around grid point. stream_density Controls closeness streamlines. density = 2 (default), domain divided 60x60 grid, whereas density linearly scales grid. cell grid can , , one traversing streamline. arrow_length Length arrows. arrow_size Size arrows. arrow_density Amount velocities show. denoise Boolean flag indicating whether denoise. denoise_topn Number genes highest likelihood selected infer velocity directions. kinetics Boolean flag indicating whether estimate RNA kinetics. kinetics_topn Number genes highest likelihood selected infer velocity directions. calculate_velocity_genes Boolean flag indicating whether calculate velocity genes. compute_velocity_confidence Whether compute velocity confidence metrics. compute_terminal_states Whether compute terminal states (root end points). compute_pseudotime Whether compute velocity pseudotime. compute_paga Whether compute PAGA (Partition-based graph abstraction). top_n number top features plot. n_jobs number parallel jobs run. palette palette use coloring cells. palcolor vector colors use palette. show_plot Whether show plot. Default FALSE. save Whether save plots. dpi DPI (dots per inch) saving plot. dirpath directory save plots. fileprefix file prefix use plots. return_seurat Whether return Seurat object instead anndata object. Default TRUE. verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE.

title: Run scVelo workflow — RunSCVELO
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(pancreas_sub) pancreas_sub <- standard_scop(pancreas_sub) pancreas_sub <- RunSCVELO(   pancreas_sub,   assay_x = "RNA",   group_by = "SubCellType",   linear_reduction = "PCA",   nonlinear_reduction = "UMAP" )  FeatureDimPlot(   pancreas_sub,   c(     "stochastic_length",     "stochastic_confidence",     "stochastic_pseudotime"   ) )  VelocityPlot(   pancreas_sub,   reduction = "UMAP",   plot_type = "stream" )  CellDimPlot(   pancreas_sub,   group.by = "SubCellType",   reduction = "UMAP",   pt.size = NA,   velocity = "stochastic" )  data(pancreas_sub) pancreas_sub <- standard_scop(pancreas_sub) pancreas_sub <- RunSCVELO(   pancreas_sub,   assay_x = "RNA",   group_by = "SubCellType",   linear_reduction = "PCA",   nonlinear_reduction = "UMAP",   mode = c("deterministic", "stochastic"),   filter_genes = TRUE,   min_counts = 5,   compute_velocity_confidence = TRUE,   compute_terminal_states = TRUE,   compute_pseudotime = TRUE,   compute_paga = TRUE ) } # }

what: Single-cell reference mapping with Seurat method — RunSeuratMap
title: Single-cell reference mapping with Seurat method — RunSeuratMap
text: Single-cell reference mapping Seurat method

title: Single-cell reference mapping with Seurat method — RunSeuratMap
code: RunSeuratMap(   srt_query,   srt_ref,   query_assay = NULL,   ref_pca = NULL,   ref_assay = srt_ref[[ref_pca]]@assay.used,   ref_dims = 1:30,   ref_umap = NULL,   ref_group = NULL,   normalization.method = "LogNormalize",   reduction_project_method = "pcaproject",   k.anchor = 5,   k.filter = 200,   k.score = 30,   k.weight = 100,   projection_method = c("model", "knn"),   nn_method = NULL,   k = 30,   distance_metric = "cosine",   vote_fun = "mean" )

title: Single-cell reference mapping with Seurat method — RunSeuratMap
text: srt_query Seurat object storing query cells. srt_ref Seurat object storing reference cells. query_assay character string specifying assay name query cells. provided, default assay query object used. ref_pca character string specifying name PCA reduction reference object use calculating distance metric. ref_assay character string specifying assay name reference cells. provided, default assay reference object used. ref_dims numeric vector specifying dimension indices reference reduction used calculating distance metric. ref_umap character string specifying name UMAP reduction reference object. provided, first UMAP reduction found reference object used. ref_group character string specifying metadata column name reference object use grouping. normalization.method normalization method use. Default `"LogNormalize"`. reduction_project_method Dimensional reduction perform finding anchors. Default `"pcaproject"`. k.anchor many neighbors (k) use finding anchors. Default `5`. k.filter many neighbors (k) use filtering anchors. Set NA turn filtering. Default `200`. k.score many neighbors (k) use scoring anchors. Default `30`. k.weight Number neighbors consider weighting anchors. Default `100`. projection_method character string specifying projection method use. Options "model" "knn". "model" selected, function try use pre-trained UMAP model reference object projection. "knn" selected, function directly find nearest neighbors using distance metric. nn_method character string specifying nearest neighbor search method use. Options "raw", "annoy", "rann". "raw" selected, function use brute-force method find nearest neighbors. "annoy" selected, function use Annoy library approximate nearest neighbor search. "rann" selected, function use RANN library approximate nearest neighbor search. provided, function choose search method based size query reference datasets. k number nearest neighbors find cell query object. distance_metric character string specifying distance metric use calculating pairwise distances cells. Options include: "pearson", "spearman", "cosine", "correlation", "jaccard", "ejaccard", "dice", "edice", "hamman", "simple matching", "faith". Additional distance metrics can also used, "euclidean", "manhattan", "hamming", etc. vote_fun character string specifying function used aggregating nearest neighbors reference object. Options "mean", "median", "sum", "min", "max", "sd", "var", etc. provided, default "mean".

title: Annotate single cells using SingleR — RunSingleR
code: RunSingleR(   srt_query,   srt_ref,   query_group = NULL,   ref_group = NULL,   query_assay = "RNA",   ref_assay = "RNA",   genes = "de",   de.method = "wilcox",   sd.thresh = 1,   de.n = NULL,   aggr.ref = FALSE,   aggr.args = list(),   quantile = 0.8,   fine.tune = TRUE,   tune.thresh = 0.05,   prune = TRUE,   cores = 1,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Annotate single cells using SingleR — RunSingleR
text: srt_query object class Seurat annotated cell types. srt_ref object class Seurat storing reference cells. query_group character vector specifying column name srt_query metadata represents cell grouping. ref_group character vector specifying column name srt_ref metadata represents cell grouping. query_assay character vector specifying assay used query data. Default default assay srt_query object. ref_assay character vector specifying assay used reference data. Default default assay srt_ref object. genes "genes" parameter SingleR::SingleR function. de.method "de.method" parameter SingleR::SingleR function. sd.thresh Deprecated ignored. de.n integer scalar specifying number DE genes use genes="de". de.method="classic", defaults 500 * (2/3) ^ log2(N) N number unique labels. Otherwise, defaults 10. Ignored genes list markers/DE genes. aggr.ref, aggr.args Arguments controlling aggregation references prior annotation, see trainSingleR. quantile "quantile" parameter SingleR::SingleR function. fine.tune "fine.tune" parameter SingleR::SingleR function. tune.thresh "tune.thresh" parameter SingleR::SingleR function. prune "prune" parameter SingleR::SingleR function. cores number cores use parallelization foreach::foreach. Default 1. verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE.

title: RunSlingshot — RunSlingshot
text: Runs Slingshot algorithm Seurat object.

title: RunSlingshot — RunSlingshot
code: RunSlingshot(   srt,   group.by,   reduction = NULL,   dims = NULL,   start = NULL,   end = NULL,   prefix = NULL,   reverse = FALSE,   align_start = FALSE,   show_plot = TRUE,   lineage_palette = "Dark2",   seed = 11,   ... )

title: RunSlingshot — RunSlingshot
text: srt Seurat object. group.variable group cells . reduction reduction technique use dimensionality reduction. Default NULL, uses default reduction Seurat object. dims dimensions use Slingshot algorithm. Default NULL, uses first two dimensions. start starting group Slingshot algorithm. Default NULL. end ending group Slingshot algorithm. Default NULL. prefix prefix add column names resulting pseudotime variable. Default NULL. reverse Logical value indicating whether reverse pseudotime variable. Default FALSE. align_start Logical value indicating whether align starting pseudotime values maximum pseudotime. Default FALSE. show_plot Logical value indicating whether show dimensionality plot. Default TRUE. lineage_palette color palette use lineages plot. Default "Dark2". seed random seed use reproducibility. Default 11. ... Additional arguments passed slingshot::slingshot function.

what: Single-cell reference mapping with Symphony method — RunSymphonyMap
title: Single-cell reference mapping with Symphony method — RunSymphonyMap
text: Single-cell reference mapping Symphony method

title: Single-cell reference mapping with Symphony method — RunSymphonyMap
code: RunSymphonyMap(   srt_query,   srt_ref,   query_assay = NULL,   ref_assay = srt_ref[[ref_pca]]@assay.used,   ref_pca = NULL,   ref_harmony = NULL,   ref_umap = NULL,   ref_group = NULL,   projection_method = c("model", "knn"),   nn_method = NULL,   k = 30,   distance_metric = "cosine",   vote_fun = "mean" )

title: Single-cell reference mapping with Symphony method — RunSymphonyMap
text: srt_query Seurat object storing query cells. srt_ref Seurat object storing reference cells. query_assay character string specifying assay name query cells. provided, default assay query object used. ref_assay character string specifying assay name reference cells. provided, default assay reference object used. ref_pca PCA reduction reference object use calculating distance metric. ref_harmony Harmony reduction reference object use calculating distance metric. ref_umap character string specifying name UMAP reduction reference object. provided, first UMAP reduction found reference object used. ref_group character string specifying metadata column name reference object use grouping. projection_method character string specifying projection method use. Options "model" "knn". "model" selected, function try use pre-trained UMAP model reference object projection. "knn" selected, function directly find nearest neighbors using distance metric. nn_method character string specifying nearest neighbor search method use. Options "raw", "annoy", "rann". "raw" selected, function use brute-force method find nearest neighbors. "annoy" selected, function use Annoy library approximate nearest neighbor search. "rann" selected, function use RANN library approximate nearest neighbor search. provided, function choose search method based size query reference datasets. k number nearest neighbors find cell query object. distance_metric character string specifying distance metric use calculating pairwise distances cells. Options include: "pearson", "spearman", "cosine", "correlation", "jaccard", "ejaccard", "dice", "edice", "hamman", "simple matching", "faith". Additional distance metrics can also used, "euclidean", "manhattan", "hamming", etc. vote_fun character string specifying function used aggregating nearest neighbors reference object. Options "mean", "median", "sum", "min", "max", "sd", "var", etc. provided, default "mean".

what: Run TriMap (Large-scale Dimensionality Reduction Using Triplets) — RunTriMap
title: Run TriMap (Large-scale Dimensionality Reduction Using Triplets) — RunTriMap
text: Run TriMap (Large-scale Dimensionality Reduction Using Triplets)

title: Run TriMap (Large-scale Dimensionality Reduction Using Triplets) — RunTriMap
code: RunTriMap(object, ...)  # S3 method for class 'Seurat' RunTriMap(   object,   reduction = "pca",   dims = NULL,   features = NULL,   assay = NULL,   layer = "data",   n_components = 2,   n_inliers = 12,   n_outliers = 4,   n_random = 3,   distance_method = "euclidean",   lr = 0.1,   n_iters = 400,   apply_pca = TRUE,   opt_method = "dbd",   reduction.name = "trimap",   reduction.key = "TriMap_",   verbose = TRUE,   seed.use = 11L,   ... )  # Default S3 method RunTriMap(   object,   assay = NULL,   n_components = 2,   n_inliers = 12,   n_outliers = 4,   n_random = 3,   distance_method = "euclidean",   lr = 0.1,   n_iters = 400,   apply_pca = TRUE,   opt_method = "dbd",   reduction.key = "TriMap_",   verbose = TRUE,   seed.use = 11L,   ... )

title: Run TriMap (Large-scale Dimensionality Reduction Using Triplets) — RunTriMap
text: object object. can Seurat object matrix-like object. ... Additional arguments passed trimap.TRIMAP function. reduction character string specifying reduction used. Default "pca". dims integer vector specifying dimensions used. Default NULL. features character vector specifying features used. Default NULL. assay character string specifying assay used. Default NULL. layer character string specifying layer used. Default "data". n_components number TriMap components. Default 2. n_inliers number nearest neighbors forming nearest neighbor triplets. Default 12. n_outliers number outliers forming nearest neighbor triplets. Default 4. n_random number random triplets per point. Default 3. distance_method character string specifying distance metric TriMap. Options : "euclidean", "manhattan", "angular", "cosine", "hamming". Default "euclidean". lr learning rate TriMap. Default 0.1. n_iters number iterations TriMap. Default 400. apply_pca Whether apply PCA nearest-neighbor calculation. Default TRUE. opt_method character string specifying optimization method TriMap. Options : "dbd", "sd", "momentum". Default "dbd". reduction.name character string specifying name reduction stored Seurat object. Default "trimap". reduction.key character string specifying prefix column names TriMap embeddings. Default "TriMap_". verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE. seed.use integer specifying random seed used. Default 11.

title: Run TriMap (Large-scale Dimensionality Reduction Using Triplets) — RunTriMap
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(pancreas_sub) pancreas_sub <- standard_scop(pancreas_sub) pancreas_sub <- RunTriMap(   object = pancreas_sub,   features = SeuratObject::VariableFeatures(pancreas_sub) ) CellDimPlot(   pancreas_sub,   group.by = "CellType",   reduction = "trimap" ) } # }

title: Run UMAP (Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection) — RunUMAP2
code: RunUMAP2(object, ...)  # S3 method for class 'Seurat' RunUMAP2(   object,   reduction = "pca",   dims = NULL,   features = NULL,   neighbor = NULL,   graph = NULL,   assay = NULL,   layer = "data",   umap.method = "uwot",   reduction.model = NULL,   n_threads = NULL,   return.model = FALSE,   n.neighbors = 30L,   n.components = 2L,   metric = "cosine",   n.epochs = 200L,   spread = 1,   min.dist = 0.3,   set.op.mix.ratio = 1,   local.connectivity = 1L,   negative.sample.rate = 5L,   a = NULL,   b = NULL,   learning.rate = 1,   repulsion.strength = 1,   reduction.name = "umap",   reduction.key = "UMAP_",   verbose = TRUE,   seed.use = 11,   ... )  # Default S3 method RunUMAP2(   object,   assay = NULL,   umap.method = "uwot",   reduction.model = NULL,   n_threads = NULL,   return.model = FALSE,   n.neighbors = 30L,   n.components = 2L,   metric = "cosine",   n.epochs = 200L,   spread = 1,   min.dist = 0.3,   set.op.mix.ratio = 1,   local.connectivity = 1L,   negative.sample.rate = 5L,   a = NULL,   b = NULL,   learning.rate = 1,   repulsion.strength = 1,   reduction.key = "UMAP_",   verbose = TRUE,   seed.use = 11L,   ... )

title: Run UMAP (Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection) — RunUMAP2
text: object object. can Seurat object, matrix-like object, Neighbor object, Graph object. ... Additional arguments passed UMAP. reduction reduction used. Default "pca". dims dimensions used. Default NULL. features features used. Default NULL. neighbor name Neighbor object used. Default NULL. graph name Graph object used. Default NULL. assay assay used. Default NULL. layer layer used. Default "data". umap.method UMAP method used. Options "naive" "uwot". Default "uwot". reduction.model DimReduc object containing pre-trained UMAP model. Default NULL. n_threads Num threads used. return.model Whether return UMAP model. Default FALSE. n.neighbors number nearest neighbors used. Default 30. n.components number UMAP components. Default 2. metric metric function used distance calculations. using string, available metrics : euclidean, manhattan. available generalized metrics : cosine, pearson, pearson2. Note triangle inequality may satisfied generalized metrics, hence knn search may optimal. using metric.function function, signature must function(matrix, origin, target) compute distance origin column target columns. Default "cosine". n.epochs number iterations performed layout optimization UMAP. Default 200. spread spread parameter UMAP, used automatic estimation /b parameters. Default 1. min.dist minimum distance UMAP embeddings, determines close points appear final layout. Default 0.3. set.op.mix.ratio Interpolate (fuzzy) union intersection set operation used combine local fuzzy simplicial sets obtain global fuzzy simplicial sets. fuzzy set operations use product t-norm. value parameter 0.0 1.0; value 1.0 use pure fuzzy union, 0.0 use pure fuzzy intersection. local.connectivity local connectivity, used construction fuzzy simplicial set. Default 1. negative.sample.rate negative sample rate UMAP optimization. Determines many non-neighbor points used per point per iteration layout optimization. Default 5. parameter UMAP optimization. Contributes gradient calculations layout optimization. left NA, suitable value estimated automatically. Default NULL. b parameter b UMAP optimization. Details see parameter . learning.rate initial value "learning rate" layout optimization. Default 1. repulsion.strength numeric value determines, together alpha, learning rate layout optimization. Default 1. reduction.name name reduction stored Seurat object. Default "umap". reduction.key prefix column names UMAP embeddings. Default "UMAP_". verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE. seed.use random seed used. Default 11.

title: Run UMAP (Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection) — RunUMAP2

title: Run WOT analysis — RunWOT
code: RunWOT(   srt = NULL,   assay_x = "RNA",   layer_x = "counts",   assay_y = c("spliced", "unspliced"),   layer_y = "counts",   adata = NULL,   group_by = NULL,   time_field = "Time",   growth_iters = 3L,   tmap_out = "tmaps/tmap_out",   time_from = NULL,   time_to = NULL,   get_coupling = FALSE,   recalculate = FALSE,   palette = "Paired",   palcolor = NULL,   show_plot = FALSE,   save = FALSE,   dpi = 300,   dirpath = "./",   fileprefix = "",   return_seurat = !is.null(srt),   verbose = TRUE )

title: Run WOT analysis — RunWOT
text: srt Seurat object. Default NULL. provided, adata ignored. assay_x Assay convert anndata object. layer_x Layer name assay_x Seurat object. assay_y Assay convert anndata object. layer_y Layer names assay_y Seurat object. adata anndata object. Default NULL. group_by Variable use grouping cells Seurat object. time_field character string specifying column name adata.obs srt@meta.data contains time information. growth_iters number growth iterations perform OT Model computation. Default 3. tmap_out character string specifying path store computed transport maps. time_from starting time point trajectory fate analysis. time_to ending time point trajectory fate analysis. provided, trajectory fate analysis specified time_from performed. get_coupling Whether compute store coupling matrix specified time_from time_to. Default FALSE. recalculate Whether recalculate transport maps even already exist specified tmap_out location. Default FALSE. palette palette use coloring cells. palcolor vector colors use palette. show_plot Whether show plot. Default FALSE. save Whether save plots. dpi DPI (dots per inch) saving plot. dirpath directory save plots. fileprefix file prefix use plots. return_seurat Whether return Seurat object instead anndata object. Default TRUE. verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE.

title: Run WOT analysis — RunWOT
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(pancreas_sub) pancreas_sub <- standard_scop(pancreas_sub) pancreas_sub <- RunSlingshot(   pancreas_sub,   group.by = "SubCellType",   reduction = "UMAP" )  print(range(pancreas_sub$Lineage1, na.rm = TRUE))  pancreas_sub <- RunWOT(   pancreas_sub,   group_by = "SubCellType",   time_field = "Lineage1",   time_from = min(pancreas_sub$Lineage1, na.rm = TRUE),   time_to = max(pancreas_sub$Lineage1, na.rm = TRUE),   get_coupling = TRUE,   tmap_out = "tmaps/lineage_tmap" )  pancreas_sub$Custom_Time <- sample(   1:10,   ncol(pancreas_sub),   replace = TRUE ) pancreas_sub <- RunWOT(   pancreas_sub,   group_by = "CellType",   time_field = "Custom_Time",   time_from = 1,   time_to = 10,   tmap_out = "tmaps/custom_tmap" ) } # }

title: The Scanorama integration function — Scanorama_integrate
code: Scanorama_integrate(   srt_merge = NULL,   batch = NULL,   append = TRUE,   srt_list = NULL,   assay = NULL,   do_normalization = NULL,   normalization_method = "LogNormalize",   do_HVF_finding = TRUE,   HVF_source = "separate",   HVF_method = "vst",   nHVF = 2000,   HVF_min_intersection = 1,   HVF = NULL,   do_scaling = TRUE,   vars_to_regress = NULL,   regression_model = "linear",   Scanorama_dims_use = NULL,   nonlinear_reduction = "umap",   nonlinear_reduction_dims = c(2, 3),   nonlinear_reduction_params = list(),   force_nonlinear_reduction = TRUE,   neighbor_metric = "euclidean",   neighbor_k = 20L,   cluster_algorithm = "louvain",   cluster_resolution = 0.6,   return_corrected = FALSE,   Scanorama_params = list(),   verbose = TRUE,   seed = 11 )

title: The Scanorama integration function — Scanorama_integrate
text: srt_merge merged `Seurat` object includes batch information. batch character string specifying batch variable name. append Whether integrated data appended original Seurat object (srt_merge). Default TRUE. srt_list list Seurat objects checked preprocessed. assay name assay used downstream analysis. do_normalization Whether data normalization performed. Default TRUE. normalization_method normalization method used. Possible values "LogNormalize", "SCT", "TFIDF". Default "LogNormalize". do_HVF_finding Whether highly variable feature (HVF) finding performed. Default TRUE. HVF_source source highly variable features. Possible values "global" "separate". Default "separate". HVF_method method selecting highly variable features. Default "vst". nHVF number highly variable features select. Default 2000. HVF_min_intersection feature needs present batches minimum number times order considered highly variable. Default 1. HVF vector highly variable features. Default NULL. do_scaling Whether perform scaling. TRUE, function force scale data using Seurat::ScaleData function. vars_to_regress vector variable names include additional regression variables. Default NULL. regression_model regression model use scaling. Options "linear", "poisson", "negativebinomial". Default "linear". Scanorama_dims_use vector specifying dimensions returned Scanorama utilized downstream cell cluster finding non-linear reduction. set NULL, returned dimensions used default. nonlinear_reduction nonlinear dimensionality reduction method use. Options "umap", "umap-naive", "tsne", "dm", "phate", "pacmap", "trimap", "largevis", "fr". Default "umap". nonlinear_reduction_dims number dimensions keep nonlinear dimensionality reduction. vector provided, different numbers dimensions can specified method. Default c(2, 3). nonlinear_reduction_params list parameters pass nonlinear dimensionality reduction method. force_nonlinear_reduction Whether force nonlinear dimensionality reduction even specified reduction already present Seurat object. Default TRUE. neighbor_metric distance metric use finding neighbors. Options "euclidean", "cosine", "manhattan", "hamming". Default "euclidean". neighbor_k number nearest neighbors use finding neighbors. Default 20. cluster_algorithm clustering algorithm use. Options "louvain", "slm", "leiden". Default "louvain". cluster_resolution resolution parameter use clustering. Larger values result fewer clusters. Default 0.6. return_corrected Logical indicating whether return corrected data. Default `FALSE`. Scanorama_params list parameters scanorama.correct function. Default `list()`. verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE. seed integer specifying random seed reproducibility. Default 11.

title: The Seurat integration function — Seurat_integrate
code: Seurat_integrate(   srt_merge = NULL,   batch = NULL,   append = TRUE,   srt_list = NULL,   assay = NULL,   do_normalization = NULL,   normalization_method = "LogNormalize",   do_HVF_finding = TRUE,   HVF_source = "separate",   HVF_method = "vst",   nHVF = 2000,   HVF_min_intersection = 1,   HVF = NULL,   do_scaling = TRUE,   vars_to_regress = NULL,   regression_model = "linear",   scale_within_batch = FALSE,   linear_reduction = "pca",   linear_reduction_dims = 50,   linear_reduction_dims_use = NULL,   linear_reduction_params = list(),   force_linear_reduction = FALSE,   nonlinear_reduction = "umap",   nonlinear_reduction_dims = c(2, 3),   nonlinear_reduction_params = list(),   force_nonlinear_reduction = TRUE,   neighbor_metric = "euclidean",   neighbor_k = 20L,   cluster_algorithm = "louvain",   cluster_resolution = 0.6,   FindIntegrationAnchors_params = list(),   IntegrateData_params = list(),   IntegrateEmbeddings_params = list(),   verbose = TRUE,   seed = 11 )

title: The Seurat integration function — Seurat_integrate
text: srt_merge merged `Seurat` object includes batch information. batch character string specifying batch variable name. append Whether integrated data appended original Seurat object (srt_merge). Default TRUE. srt_list list Seurat objects checked preprocessed. assay name assay used downstream analysis. do_normalization Whether data normalization performed. Default TRUE. normalization_method normalization method used. Possible values "LogNormalize", "SCT", "TFIDF". Default "LogNormalize". do_HVF_finding Whether highly variable feature (HVF) finding performed. Default TRUE. HVF_source source highly variable features. Possible values "global" "separate". Default "separate". HVF_method method selecting highly variable features. Default "vst". nHVF number highly variable features select. Default 2000. HVF_min_intersection feature needs present batches minimum number times order considered highly variable. Default 1. HVF vector highly variable features. Default NULL. do_scaling Whether perform scaling. TRUE, function force scale data using Seurat::ScaleData function. vars_to_regress vector variable names include additional regression variables. Default NULL. regression_model regression model use scaling. Options "linear", "poisson", "negativebinomial". Default "linear". scale_within_batch Whether scale data within batch. valid integration_method one "Uncorrected", "Seurat", "MNN", "Harmony", "BBKNN", "CSS", "ComBat". linear_reduction linear dimensionality reduction method use. Options "pca", "svd", "ica", "nmf", "mds", "glmpca". Default "pca". linear_reduction_dims number dimensions keep linear dimensionality reduction. Default 50. linear_reduction_dims_use dimensions use downstream analysis. NULL, dimensions used. linear_reduction_params list parameters pass linear dimensionality reduction method. force_linear_reduction Whether force linear dimensionality reduction even specified reduction already present Seurat object. nonlinear_reduction nonlinear dimensionality reduction method use. Options "umap", "umap-naive", "tsne", "dm", "phate", "pacmap", "trimap", "largevis", "fr". Default "umap". nonlinear_reduction_dims number dimensions keep nonlinear dimensionality reduction. vector provided, different numbers dimensions can specified method. Default c(2, 3). nonlinear_reduction_params list parameters pass nonlinear dimensionality reduction method. force_nonlinear_reduction Whether force nonlinear dimensionality reduction even specified reduction already present Seurat object. Default TRUE. neighbor_metric distance metric use finding neighbors. Options "euclidean", "cosine", "manhattan", "hamming". Default "euclidean". neighbor_k number nearest neighbors use finding neighbors. Default 20. cluster_algorithm clustering algorithm use. Options "louvain", "slm", "leiden". Default "louvain". cluster_resolution resolution parameter use clustering. Larger values result fewer clusters. Default 0.6. FindIntegrationAnchors_params list parameters Seurat::FindIntegrationAnchors function. Default `list()`. IntegrateData_params list parameters Seurat::IntegrateData function. Default `list()`. IntegrateEmbeddings_params list parameters Seurat::IntegrateEmbeddings function. Default `list()`. verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE. seed integer specifying random seed reproducibility. Default 11.

title: Statistic Plot — StatPlot

title: Statistic Plot — StatPlot
code: StatPlot(   meta.data,   stat.by,   group.by = NULL,   split.by = NULL,   bg.by = NULL,   flip = FALSE,   NA_color = "grey",   NA_stat = TRUE,   keep_empty = FALSE,   individual = FALSE,   stat_level = NULL,   plot_type = c("bar", "rose", "ring", "pie", "trend", "area", "dot", "sankey", "chord",     "venn", "upset"),   stat_type = c("percent", "count"),   position = c("stack", "dodge"),   palette = "Paired",   palcolor = NULL,   alpha = 1,   bg_palette = "Paired",   bg_palcolor = NULL,   bg_alpha = 0.2,   label = FALSE,   label.size = 3.5,   label.fg = "black",   label.bg = "white",   label.bg.r = 0.1,   aspect.ratio = NULL,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   xlab = NULL,   ylab = NULL,   legend.position = "right",   legend.direction = "vertical",   theme_use = "theme_scop",   theme_args = list(),   combine = TRUE,   nrow = NULL,   ncol = NULL,   byrow = TRUE,   force = FALSE,   seed = 11 )

title: Statistic Plot — StatPlot
text: meta.data data frame containing data plotted. stat.column name(s) meta.data specifying variable(s) plotted. group.column name meta.data specifying grouping variable. split.column name meta.data specifying splitting variable. bg.column name meta.data specifying background variable bar plots. flip Whether flip plot. Default FALSE. NA_color color use missing values. NA_stat Whether include missing values plot. Default TRUE. keep_empty Whether keep empty groups plot. Default FALSE. individual Whether plot individual groups separately. Default FALSE. stat_level level(s) variable(s) specified stat.include plot. Default NULL. plot_type type plot create. Can one "bar", "rose", "ring", "pie", "trend", "area", "dot", "sankey", "chord", "venn", "upset". stat_type type statistic compute plot. Can one "percent" "count". position position adjustment plot. Can one "stack" "dodge". palette name color palette use plot. palcolor color use color palette. alpha transparency level plot. bg_palette name background color palette use bar plots. bg_palcolor color use background color palette. bg_alpha transparency level background color bar plots. label Whether add labels plot. Default FALSE. label.size size labels. label.fg foreground color labels. label.bg background color labels. label.bg.r radius rounded corners label background. aspect.ratio aspect ratio plot. title main title plot. subtitle subtitle plot. xlab x-axis label plot. ylab y-axis label plot. legend.position position legend plot. Can one "right", "left", "bottom", "top", "none". legend.direction direction legend plot. Can one "vertical" "horizontal". theme_use name theme use plot. Can one predefined themes custom theme. theme_args list arguments passed theme function. combine Whether combine multiple plots single plot. Default TRUE. nrow number rows combined plot. Default NULL. ncol number columns combined plot. Default NULL. byrow Whether fill plot row column. Default TRUE. force Whether force plot even variables 100 levels. Default FALSE. seed random seed use reproducible results. Default 11.

title: The Uncorrected integration function — Uncorrected_integrate
text: Uncorrected integration function

title: The Uncorrected integration function — Uncorrected_integrate
code: Uncorrected_integrate(   srt_merge = NULL,   batch = NULL,   append = TRUE,   srt_list = NULL,   assay = NULL,   do_normalization = NULL,   normalization_method = "LogNormalize",   do_HVF_finding = TRUE,   HVF_source = "separate",   HVF_method = "vst",   nHVF = 2000,   HVF_min_intersection = 1,   HVF = NULL,   do_scaling = TRUE,   vars_to_regress = NULL,   regression_model = "linear",   scale_within_batch = FALSE,   linear_reduction = "pca",   linear_reduction_dims = 50,   linear_reduction_dims_use = NULL,   linear_reduction_params = list(),   force_linear_reduction = FALSE,   nonlinear_reduction = "umap",   nonlinear_reduction_dims = c(2, 3),   nonlinear_reduction_params = list(),   force_nonlinear_reduction = TRUE,   neighbor_metric = "euclidean",   neighbor_k = 20L,   cluster_algorithm = "louvain",   cluster_resolution = 0.6,   verbose = TRUE,   seed = 11 )

title: The Uncorrected integration function — Uncorrected_integrate
text: srt_merge merged `Seurat` object includes batch information. batch character string specifying batch variable name. append Whether integrated data appended original Seurat object (srt_merge). Default TRUE. srt_list list Seurat objects checked preprocessed. assay name assay used downstream analysis. do_normalization Whether data normalization performed. Default TRUE. normalization_method normalization method used. Possible values "LogNormalize", "SCT", "TFIDF". Default "LogNormalize". do_HVF_finding Whether highly variable feature (HVF) finding performed. Default TRUE. HVF_source source highly variable features. Possible values "global" "separate". Default "separate". HVF_method method selecting highly variable features. Default "vst". nHVF number highly variable features select. Default 2000. HVF_min_intersection feature needs present batches minimum number times order considered highly variable. Default 1. HVF vector highly variable features. Default NULL. do_scaling Whether perform scaling. TRUE, function force scale data using Seurat::ScaleData function. vars_to_regress vector variable names include additional regression variables. Default NULL. regression_model regression model use scaling. Options "linear", "poisson", "negativebinomial". Default "linear". scale_within_batch Whether scale data within batch. valid integration_method one "Uncorrected", "Seurat", "MNN", "Harmony", "BBKNN", "CSS", "ComBat". linear_reduction linear dimensionality reduction method use. Options "pca", "svd", "ica", "nmf", "mds", "glmpca". Default "pca". linear_reduction_dims number dimensions keep linear dimensionality reduction. Default 50. linear_reduction_dims_use dimensions use downstream analysis. NULL, dimensions used. linear_reduction_params list parameters pass linear dimensionality reduction method. force_linear_reduction Whether force linear dimensionality reduction even specified reduction already present Seurat object. nonlinear_reduction nonlinear dimensionality reduction method use. Options "umap", "umap-naive", "tsne", "dm", "phate", "pacmap", "trimap", "largevis", "fr". Default "umap". nonlinear_reduction_dims number dimensions keep nonlinear dimensionality reduction. vector provided, different numbers dimensions can specified method. Default c(2, 3). nonlinear_reduction_params list parameters pass nonlinear dimensionality reduction method. force_nonlinear_reduction Whether force nonlinear dimensionality reduction even specified reduction already present Seurat object. Default TRUE. neighbor_metric distance metric use finding neighbors. Options "euclidean", "cosine", "manhattan", "hamming". Default "euclidean". neighbor_k number nearest neighbors use finding neighbors. Default 20. cluster_algorithm clustering algorithm use. Options "louvain", "slm", "leiden". Default "louvain". cluster_resolution resolution parameter use clustering. Larger values result fewer clusters. Default 0.6. verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE. seed integer specifying random seed reproducibility. Default 11.

title: Velocity Plot — VelocityPlot
text: function creates velocity plot given Seurat object. plot shows velocity vectors cells specified reduction space.

title: Velocity Plot — VelocityPlot
code: VelocityPlot(   srt,   reduction,   dims = c(1, 2),   cells = NULL,   velocity = "stochastic",   plot_type = c("raw", "grid", "stream"),   group_by = NULL,   group_palette = "Paired",   group_palcolor = NULL,   n_neighbors = ceiling(ncol(srt@assays[[1]])/50),   density = 1,   smooth = 0.5,   scale = 1,   min_mass = 1,   cutoff_perc = 5,   arrow_angle = 20,   arrow_color = "black",   streamline_L = 5,   streamline_minL = 1,   streamline_res = 1,   streamline_n = 15,   streamline_width = c(0, 0.8),   streamline_alpha = 1,   streamline_color = NULL,   streamline_palette = "RdYlBu",   streamline_palcolor = NULL,   streamline_bg_color = "white",   streamline_bg_stroke = 0.5,   aspect.ratio = 1,   title = "Cell velocity",   subtitle = NULL,   xlab = NULL,   ylab = NULL,   legend.position = "right",   legend.direction = "vertical",   theme_use = "theme_scop",   theme_args = list(),   return_layer = FALSE,   seed = 11 )

title: Velocity Plot — VelocityPlot
text: srt Seurat object. reduction Name reduction Seurat object use plotting. dims Indices dimensions use plotting. cells Cells include plot. NULL, cells included. velocity Name velocity use plotting. Default "stochastic". plot_type Type plot create. Can "raw", "grid", "stream". group_by Name column Seurat object metadata group cells . Defaults NULL. group_palette Name palette use coloring groups. Defaults "Paired". group_palcolor Colors use coloring groups. Defaults NULL. n_neighbors Number neighbors include density estimation. Defaults ceiling(ncol(srt@assays[[1]]) / 50). density Propotion cells plot. Defaults 1 (plot cells). smooth Smoothing parameter density estimation. Defaults 0.5. scale Scaling factor velocity vectors. Defaults 1. min_mass Minimum mass value density-based cutoff. Defaults 1. cutoff_perc Percentile value density-based cutoff. Defaults 5. arrow_angle Angle arrowheads. Defaults 20. arrow_color Color arrowheads. Defaults "black". streamline_L Length streamlines. Defaults 5. streamline_minL Minimum length streamlines. Defaults 1. streamline_res Resolution streamlines. Defaults 1. streamline_n Number streamlines plot. Defaults 15. streamline_width Width streamlines. Defaults c(0, 0.8). streamline_alpha Alpha transparency streamlines. Defaults 1. streamline_color Color streamlines. Defaults NULL. streamline_palette Name palette use coloring streamlines. Defaults "RdYlBu". streamline_palcolor Colors use coloring streamlines. Defaults NULL. streamline_bg_color Background color streamlines. Defaults "white". streamline_bg_stroke Stroke width streamlines background. Defaults 0.5. aspect.ratio Aspect ratio plot. Defaults 1. title Title plot. Defaults "Cell velocity". subtitle Subtitle plot. Defaults NULL. xlab x-axis label. Defaults NULL. ylab y-axis label. Defaults NULL. legend.position Position legend. Defaults "right". legend.direction Direction legend. Defaults "vertical". theme_use Name theme use plotting. Defaults "theme_scop". theme_args List theme arguments customization. Defaults list(). return_layer Whether return plot layers list. Defaults FALSE. seed Random seed reproducibility. Defaults 11.

title: Volcano Plot — VolcanoPlot
text: Generate volcano plot based differential expression analysis results.

title: Volcano Plot — VolcanoPlot
code: VolcanoPlot(   srt,   group_by = NULL,   test.use = "wilcox",   DE_threshold = "avg_log2FC > 0 & p_val_adj < 0.05",   x_metric = "diff_pct",   palette = "RdBu",   palcolor = NULL,   pt.size = 1,   pt.alpha = 1,   cols.highlight = "black",   sizes.highlight = 1,   alpha.highlight = 1,   stroke.highlight = 0.5,   nlabel = 5,   features_label = NULL,   label.fg = "black",   label.bg = "white",   label.bg.r = 0.1,   label.size = 4,   aspect.ratio = NULL,   xlab = x_metric,   ylab = "-log10(p-adjust)",   theme_use = "theme_scop",   theme_args = list(),   combine = TRUE,   nrow = NULL,   ncol = NULL,   byrow = TRUE )

title: Volcano Plot — VolcanoPlot
text: srt object class Seurat containing results differential expression analysis. group_by character vector specifying column srt group samples . Default NULL. test.use character string specifying type statistical test use. Default "wilcox". DE_threshold character string specifying threshold differential expression. Default "avg_log2FC > 0 & p_val_adj < 0.05". x_metric character string specifying metric use x-axis. Default "diff_pct". palette character string specifying color palette use plot. Default "RdBu". palcolor character string specifying color palette. Default NULL. pt.size size points. Default 1. pt.alpha transparency points. Default 1. cols.highlight character string specifying color highlighted points. Default "black". sizes.highlight size highlighted points. Default 1. alpha.highlight transparency highlighted points. Default 1. stroke.highlight stroke width highlighted points. Default 0.5. nlabel integer value specifying number labeled points per group. Default 5. features_label character vector specifying feature labels plot. Default NULL. label.fg character string specifying color labels' foreground. Default "black". label.bg character string specifying color labels' background. Default "white". label.bg.r radius rounding labels' background. Default 0.1. label.size size labels. Default 4. aspect.ratio aspect ratio plot. Default NULL. xlab character string specifying x-axis label. Default value x_metric. ylab character string specifying y-axis label. Default "-log10(p-adjust)". theme_use character string specifying theme use plot. Default "theme_scop". theme_args list theme arguments pass theme_use function. Default list(). combine Whether combine plots group single plot. Default TRUE. nrow integer value specifying number rows combined plot. Default NULL. ncol integer value specifying number columns combined plot. Default NULL. byrow Whether arrange plots row combined plot. Default TRUE.

title: Check and install python packages — check_python
text: packages character vector package names check install. Use "<package>==<version>" request specific version. envname name conda environment. NULL, environment name set "scop_env". Default NULL. conda path conda executable. Use "auto" allow automatically finding appropriate conda binary. force Whether force package reinstallation. Default FALSE. pip Whether use pip/uv (TRUE) conda (FALSE) installation. Default TRUE. TRUE, uv used primary installer pip fallback. pip_options Additional command line arguments passed uv/pip pip = TRUE. verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE. ... arguments passed conda_install().

title: Compute velocity on grid — compute_velocity_on_grid
text: Compute velocity grid

title: Compute velocity on grid — compute_velocity_on_grid
code: compute_velocity_on_grid(   x_emb,   v_emb,   density = 1,   smooth = 0.5,   n_neighbors = ceiling(n_obs/50),   min_mass = 1,   scale = 1,   adjust_for_stream = FALSE,   cutoff_perc = 5 )

title: Compute velocity on grid — compute_velocity_on_grid
text: x_emb matrix dimension n_obs x n_dim specifying embedding coordinates cells. v_emb matrix dimension n_obs x n_dim specifying velocity vectors cells. density numeric value specifying density grid points along dimension. Default 1. smooth numeric value specifying smoothing factor velocity vectors. Default 0.5. n_neighbors numeric value specifying number nearest neighbors grid point. Default ceiling(n_obs / 50). min_mass numeric value specifying minimum mass required grid point considered. Default 1. scale numeric value specifying scaling factor velocity vectors. Default 1. adjust_for_stream Whether adjust velocity vectors streamlines. Default FALSE. cutoff_perc numeric value specifying percentile cutoff removing low-density grid points. Default 5.

title: Compute velocity on grid — compute_velocity_on_grid
text: https://github.com/theislab/scvelo/blob/master/scvelo/plotting/velocity_embedding_grid.py

title: Run doublet-calling with DoubletDetection — db_DoubletDetection
text: function performs doublet-calling using doubletdetection(python) package Seurat object.

title: Run doublet-calling with DoubletDetection — db_DoubletDetection
code: db_DoubletDetection(srt, assay = "RNA", db_rate = ncol(srt)/1000 * 0.01, ...)

title: Run doublet-calling with DoubletDetection — db_DoubletDetection
text: srt Seurat object. assay name assay used doublet-calling. Default "RNA". db_rate expected doublet rate. Default calculated ncol(srt) / 1000 * 0.01. ... Additional arguments passed doubletdetection.BoostClassifier.

title: Run doublet-calling with DoubletDetection — db_DoubletDetection
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(pancreas_sub) pancreas_sub <- standard_scop(pancreas_sub) pancreas_sub <- db_DoubletDetection(pancreas_sub) CellDimPlot(   pancreas_sub,   reduction = "umap",   group.by = "db.DoubletDetection_class" )  FeatureDimPlot(   pancreas_sub,   reduction = "umap",   features = "db.DoubletDetection_score" ) } # }

code: fastMNN_integrate(   srt_merge = NULL,   batch = NULL,   append = TRUE,   srt_list = NULL,   assay = NULL,   do_normalization = NULL,   normalization_method = "LogNormalize",   do_HVF_finding = TRUE,   HVF_source = "separate",   HVF_method = "vst",   nHVF = 2000,   HVF_min_intersection = 1,   HVF = NULL,   fastMNN_dims_use = NULL,   nonlinear_reduction = "umap",   nonlinear_reduction_dims = c(2, 3),   nonlinear_reduction_params = list(),   force_nonlinear_reduction = TRUE,   neighbor_metric = "euclidean",   neighbor_k = 20L,   cluster_algorithm = "louvain",   cluster_resolution = 0.6,   fastMNN_params = list(),   verbose = TRUE,   seed = 11 )

title: The fastMNN integration function — fastMNN_integrate
text: srt_merge merged `Seurat` object includes batch information. batch character string specifying batch variable name. append Whether integrated data appended original Seurat object (srt_merge). Default TRUE. srt_list list Seurat objects checked preprocessed. assay name assay used downstream analysis. do_normalization Whether data normalization performed. Default TRUE. normalization_method normalization method used. Possible values "LogNormalize", "SCT", "TFIDF". Default "LogNormalize". do_HVF_finding Whether highly variable feature (HVF) finding performed. Default TRUE. HVF_source source highly variable features. Possible values "global" "separate". Default "separate". HVF_method method selecting highly variable features. Default "vst". nHVF number highly variable features select. Default 2000. HVF_min_intersection feature needs present batches minimum number times order considered highly variable. Default 1. HVF vector highly variable features. Default NULL. fastMNN_dims_use vector specifying dimensions returned fastMNN utilized downstream cell cluster finding non-linear reduction. set NULL, returned dimensions used default. nonlinear_reduction nonlinear dimensionality reduction method use. Options "umap", "umap-naive", "tsne", "dm", "phate", "pacmap", "trimap", "largevis", "fr". Default "umap". nonlinear_reduction_dims number dimensions keep nonlinear dimensionality reduction. vector provided, different numbers dimensions can specified method. Default c(2, 3). nonlinear_reduction_params list parameters pass nonlinear dimensionality reduction method. force_nonlinear_reduction Whether force nonlinear dimensionality reduction even specified reduction already present Seurat object. Default TRUE. neighbor_metric distance metric use finding neighbors. Options "euclidean", "cosine", "manhattan", "hamming". Default "euclidean". neighbor_k number nearest neighbors use finding neighbors. Default 20. cluster_algorithm clustering algorithm use. Options "louvain", "slm", "leiden". Default "louvain". cluster_resolution resolution parameter use clustering. Larger values result fewer clusters. Default 0.6. fastMNN_params list parameters batchelor::fastMNN function, default empty list. verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE. seed integer specifying random seed reproducibility. Default 11.

title: The integration_scop function — integration_scop
text: srt_merge merged `Seurat` object includes batch information. batch character string specifying batch variable name. append Whether integrated data appended original Seurat object (srt_merge). Default TRUE. srt_list list Seurat objects checked preprocessed. assay name assay used downstream analysis. integration_method character vector specifying integration method use. Supported methods : "Uncorrected", "Seurat", "scVI", "MNN", "fastMNN", "Harmony", "Scanorama", "BBKNN", "CSS", "LIGER", "Conos", "ComBat". Default "Uncorrected". do_normalization Whether data normalization performed. Default TRUE. normalization_method normalization method used. Possible values "LogNormalize", "SCT", "TFIDF". Default "LogNormalize". do_HVF_finding Whether highly variable feature (HVF) finding performed. Default TRUE. HVF_source source highly variable features. Possible values "global" "separate". Default "separate". HVF_method method selecting highly variable features. Default "vst". nHVF number highly variable features select. Default 2000. HVF_min_intersection feature needs present batches minimum number times order considered highly variable. Default 1. HVF vector highly variable features. Default NULL. do_scaling Whether perform scaling. TRUE, function force scale data using Seurat::ScaleData function. vars_to_regress vector variable names include additional regression variables. Default NULL. regression_model regression model use scaling. Options "linear", "poisson", "negativebinomial". Default "linear". scale_within_batch Whether scale data within batch. valid integration_method one "Uncorrected", "Seurat", "MNN", "Harmony", "BBKNN", "CSS", "ComBat". linear_reduction linear dimensionality reduction method use. Options "pca", "svd", "ica", "nmf", "mds", "glmpca". Default "pca". linear_reduction_dims number dimensions keep linear dimensionality reduction. Default 50. linear_reduction_dims_use dimensions use downstream analysis. NULL, dimensions used. linear_reduction_params list parameters pass linear dimensionality reduction method. force_linear_reduction Whether force linear dimensionality reduction even specified reduction already present Seurat object. nonlinear_reduction nonlinear dimensionality reduction method use. Options "umap", "umap-naive", "tsne", "dm", "phate", "pacmap", "trimap", "largevis", "fr". Default "umap". nonlinear_reduction_dims number dimensions keep nonlinear dimensionality reduction. vector provided, different numbers dimensions can specified method. Default c(2, 3). nonlinear_reduction_params list parameters pass nonlinear dimensionality reduction method. force_nonlinear_reduction Whether force nonlinear dimensionality reduction even specified reduction already present Seurat object. Default TRUE. neighbor_metric distance metric use finding neighbors. Options "euclidean", "cosine", "manhattan", "hamming". Default "euclidean". neighbor_k number nearest neighbors use finding neighbors. Default 20. cluster_algorithm clustering algorithm use. Options "louvain", "slm", "leiden". Default "louvain". cluster_resolution resolution parameter use clustering. Larger values result fewer clusters. Default 0.6. seed integer specifying random seed reproducibility. Default 11. verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE. ... Additional arguments passed integration method functions.

title: The integration_scop function — integration_scop
code: data(panc8_sub) panc8_sub <- integration_scop(   panc8_sub,   batch = "tech",   integration_method = "Uncorrected" ) CellDimPlot(   panc8_sub,   group.by = c("tech", "celltype") )   panc8_sub <- integration_scop(   panc8_sub,   batch = "tech",   integration_method = "Uncorrected",   HVF_min_intersection = 5 ) CellDimPlot(   panc8_sub,   group.by = c("tech", "celltype") )   panc8_sub <- integration_scop(   panc8_sub,   batch = "tech",   integration_method = "Uncorrected",   HVF_min_intersection = 5,   scale_within_batch = TRUE ) CellDimPlot(   panc8_sub,   group.by = c("tech", "celltype") )   if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ panc8_sub <- integration_scop(   panc8_sub,   batch = "tech",   integration_method = "Seurat" ) CellDimPlot(panc8_sub, group.by = c("tech", "celltype"))  panc8_sub <- integration_scop(   panc8_sub,   batch = "tech",   integration_method = "Seurat",   FindIntegrationAnchors_params = list(reduction = "rpca") ) CellDimPlot(panc8_sub, group.by = c("tech", "celltype"))  integration_methods <- c(   "Uncorrected", "Seurat", "scVI", "MNN", "fastMNN", "Harmony",   "Scanorama", "BBKNN", "CSS", "LIGER", "Conos", "ComBat" ) for (method in integration_methods) {   panc8_sub <- integration_scop(     panc8_sub,     batch = "tech",     integration_method = method,     linear_reduction_dims_use = 1:50,     nonlinear_reduction = "umap"   )   print(     CellDimPlot(panc8_sub,       group.by = c("tech", "celltype"),       reduction = paste0(method, "UMAP2D"),       xlab = "", ylab = "", title = method,       legend.position = "none", theme_use = "theme_blank"     )   ) }  nonlinear_reductions <- c(   "umap", "tsne", "dm", "phate",   "pacmap", "trimap", "largevis", "fr" ) panc8_sub <- integration_scop(   panc8_sub,   batch = "tech",   integration_method = "Seurat",   linear_reduction_dims_use = 1:50,   nonlinear_reduction = nonlinear_reductions ) for (nr in nonlinear_reductions) {   print(     CellDimPlot(       panc8_sub,       group.by = c("tech", "celltype"),       reduction = paste0("Seurat", nr, "2D"),       xlab = "", ylab = "", title = nr,       legend.position = "none", theme_use = "theme_blank"     )   ) } } # }

what: Detect outliers using MAD (Median Absolute Deviation) — is_outlier
title: Detect outliers using MAD (Median Absolute Deviation) — is_outlier
text: function detects outliers numeric vector using MAD (Median Absolute Deviation) method. calculates median MAD, determines boundaries outliers based median selected number MADs.

title: Detect outliers using MAD (Median Absolute Deviation) — is_outlier
code: is_outlier(   x,   nmads = 2.5,   constant = 1.4826,   type = c("both", "lower", "higher") )

title: Detect outliers using MAD (Median Absolute Deviation) — is_outlier
text: x Numeric vector. nmads Number median absolute deviations (MADs) median define boundaries outliers. Default 2.5. constant Constant factor convert MAD standard deviation. Default 1.4826, consistent MAD normal distribution. type Type outliers detect. Available options "", "lower", "higher". type "", detects lower higher outliers. type "lower", detects lower outliers. type "higher", detects higher outliers.

title: Detect outliers using MAD (Median Absolute Deviation) — is_outlier
text: Numeric vector indices indicating positions outliers x.

title: Detect outliers using MAD (Median Absolute Deviation) — is_outlier
code: x <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 100) is_outlier(x) # returns 6 #> [1] 6  x <- c(3, 4, 5, NA, 6, 7) is_outlier(x, nmads = 1.5, type = "lower") # returns 4 #> [1] 4  x <- c(10, 20, NA, 15, 35) is_outlier(x, nmads = 2, type = "higher") # returns 3, 5 #> [1] 3 5

text: Human pancreatic islet cell datasets produced across four technologies, SMART-Seq2 (E-MTAB-5061), CelSeq (GSE81076), CelSeq2 (GSE85241), Fluidigm C1 (GSE86469), SeuratData package. data set panc8, 200 cells downsampled form panc8_sub dataset.

title: A subsetted version of human 'panc8' datasets — panc8_sub
text: Seurat object.

title: A subsetted version of human 'panc8' datasets — panc8_sub
A subsetted version of human 'panc8' datasets — panc8_sub
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ if (interactive()) {   data(pancreas_sub)   if (!require("SeuratData", quietly = TRUE)) {     pak::pak("satijalab/seurat-data")   }   library(SeuratData)   library(Seurat)   InstallData("panc8")   data(panc8)   panc8 <- UpdateSeuratObject(panc8)   set.seed(98)   cells_sub <- unlist(     lapply(       split(colnames(panc8), panc8$dataset),       function(x) sample(x, size = 200)     )   )   panc8_sub <- subset(panc8, cells = cells_sub)   counts <- GetAssayData5(     panc8_sub,     layer = "counts"   )   panc8_sub <- CreateSeuratObject(     counts = counts,     meta.data = panc8_sub@meta.data   )   panc8_sub <- panc8_sub[Matrix::rowSums(counts) > 0, ]   panc8_sub <- panc8_sub[toupper(     rownames(panc8_sub)   ) %in% toupper(     rownames(pancreas_sub)   ), ]   panc8_sub$celltype <- gsub("_", "-", panc8_sub$celltype)   panc8_sub$celltype <- gsub(" ", "-", panc8_sub$celltype)   usethis::use_data(     panc8_sub,     compress = "xz",     overwrite = TRUE   ) } } # }

title: A subsetted version of mouse 'pancreas' datasets — pancreas_sub
text: scvelo.datasets.pancreas, endocrinogenesis_day15.h5ad

title: A subsetted version of mouse 'pancreas' datasets — pancreas_sub
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ if (interactive()) {   library(Seurat)   library(reticulate)   PrepareEnv()   check_python("scvelo")   scv <- import("scvelo")   adata <- scv$datasets$pancreas()   pancreas <- adata_to_srt(adata)   set.seed(98)   cells <- sample(colnames(pancreas), size = 1000)   pancreas_sub <- pancreas[, cells]   pancreas_sub <- pancreas_sub[Matrix::rowSums(     GetAssayData5(       pancreas_sub,       layer = "counts"     )   ) > 0, ]   pancreas_sub[["CellType"]] <- pancreas_sub[["clusters_coarse"]]   pancreas_sub[["SubCellType"]] <- pancreas_sub[["clusters"]]   pancreas_sub[["clusters_coarse"]] <- pancreas_sub[["clusters"]] <- NULL   pancreas_sub[["Phase"]] <- ifelse(     pancreas_sub$S_score > pancreas_sub$G2M_score,     "S",     "G2M"   )   pancreas_sub[["Phase"]][apply(     pancreas_sub[[]][, c("S_score", "G2M_score")],     1,     max   ) < 0, ] <- "G1"   pancreas_sub[["Phase", drop = TRUE]] <- factor(     pancreas_sub[["Phase", drop = TRUE]],     levels = c("G1", "S", "G2M")   )   pancreas_sub$CellType <- gsub("_", "-", pancreas_sub$CellType)   pancreas_sub$CellType <- gsub(" ", "-", pancreas_sub$CellType)   pancreas_sub$SubCellType <- gsub("_", "-", pancreas_sub$SubCellType)   pancreas_sub$SubCellType <- gsub(" ", "-", pancreas_sub$SubCellType)   usethis::use_data(     pancreas_sub,     compress = "xz",     overwrite = TRUE   ) } } # }

what: Convert a Seurat object to an AnnData object — srt_to_adata
title: Convert a Seurat object to an AnnData object — srt_to_adata
text: function takes Seurat object converts anndata object using reticulate package.

title: Convert a Seurat object to an AnnData object — srt_to_adata
code: srt_to_adata(   srt,   features = NULL,   assay_x = "RNA",   layer_x = "counts",   assay_y = c("spliced", "unspliced"),   layer_y = "counts",   convert_tools = FALSE,   convert_misc = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Convert a Seurat object to an AnnData object — srt_to_adata
text: srt Seurat object. features Optional vector features include anndata object. Default features assay_x. assay_x Assay convert main data matrix anndata object. Default "RNA". layer_x Layer name assay_x Seurat object. Default "counts". assay_y Assays convert layers anndata object. Default c("spliced", "unspliced"). layer_y Layer names assay_y Seurat object. Default "counts". convert_tools Whether convert tool-specific data. Default FALSE. convert_misc Whether convert miscellaneous data. Default FALSE. verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE.

title: Convert a Seurat object to an AnnData object — srt_to_adata
text: anndata object.

title: Convert a Seurat object to an AnnData object — srt_to_adata
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(pancreas_sub) adata <- srt_to_adata(pancreas_sub) adata  # Or save as a h5ad/loom file adata$write_h5ad(   "pancreas_sub.h5ad" ) adata$write_loom(   "pancreas_sub.loom",   write_obsm_varm = TRUE ) } # }

title: Standard workflow for scop — standard_scop
text: function performs standard single-cell analysis workflow.

title: Standard workflow for scop — standard_scop
code: standard_scop(   srt,   prefix = "Standard",   assay = NULL,   do_normalization = NULL,   normalization_method = "LogNormalize",   do_HVF_finding = TRUE,   HVF_method = "vst",   nHVF = 2000,   HVF = NULL,   do_scaling = TRUE,   vars_to_regress = NULL,   regression_model = "linear",   linear_reduction = "pca",   linear_reduction_dims = 50,   linear_reduction_dims_use = NULL,   linear_reduction_params = list(),   force_linear_reduction = FALSE,   nonlinear_reduction = "umap",   nonlinear_reduction_dims = c(2, 3),   nonlinear_reduction_params = list(),   force_nonlinear_reduction = TRUE,   neighbor_metric = "euclidean",   neighbor_k = 20L,   cluster_algorithm = "louvain",   cluster_resolution = 0.6,   verbose = TRUE,   seed = 11 )

title: Standard workflow for scop — standard_scop
text: srt Seurat object. prefix prefix add names intermediate objects created function. Default "Standard". assay name assay use analysis. NULL, default assay Seurat object used. do_normalization Whether perform normalization. NULL, normalization performed specified assay scaled data. normalization_method method use normalization. Options "LogNormalize", "SCT", "TFIDF". Default "LogNormalize". do_HVF_finding Whether perform high variable feature finding. TRUE, function force find highly variable features (HVF) using specified HVF method. HVF_method method use finding highly variable features. Options "vst", "mvp", "disp". Default "vst". nHVF number highly variable features select. NULL, highly variable features used. HVF vector feature names use highly variable features. NULL, function use highly variable features identified HVF method. do_scaling Whether perform scaling. TRUE, function force scale data using Seurat::ScaleData function. vars_to_regress vector feature names use regressors scaling step. NULL, regressors used. regression_model regression model use scaling. Options "linear", "poisson", "negativebinomial". Default "linear". linear_reduction linear dimensionality reduction method use. Options "pca", "svd", "ica", "nmf", "mds", "glmpca". Default "pca". linear_reduction_dims number dimensions keep linear dimensionality reduction. Default 50. linear_reduction_dims_use dimensions use downstream analysis. NULL, dimensions used. linear_reduction_params list parameters pass linear dimensionality reduction method. force_linear_reduction Whether force linear dimensionality reduction even specified reduction already present Seurat object. nonlinear_reduction nonlinear dimensionality reduction method use. Options "umap", "umap-naive", "tsne", "dm", "phate", "pacmap", "trimap", "largevis", "fr". Default "umap". nonlinear_reduction_dims number dimensions keep nonlinear dimensionality reduction. vector provided, different numbers dimensions can specified method. Default c(2, 3). nonlinear_reduction_params list parameters pass nonlinear dimensionality reduction method. force_nonlinear_reduction Whether force nonlinear dimensionality reduction even specified reduction already present Seurat object. Default TRUE. neighbor_metric distance metric use finding neighbors. Options "euclidean", "cosine", "manhattan", "hamming". Default "euclidean". neighbor_k number nearest neighbors use finding neighbors. Default 20. cluster_algorithm clustering algorithm use. Options "louvain", "slm", "leiden". Default "louvain". cluster_resolution resolution parameter use clustering. Larger values result fewer clusters. Default 0.6. verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE. seed random seed use reproducibility. Default 11.

title: Standard workflow for scop — standard_scop
text: Seurat object.

title: Standard workflow for scop — standard_scop
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(Matrix) data(pancreas_sub) pancreas_sub <- standard_scop(pancreas_sub) CellDimPlot(   pancreas_sub,   group.by = "SubCellType" )  # Use a combination of different linear # or non-linear dimension reduction methods linear_reductions <- c(   "pca", "nmf", "mds", "glmpca" ) pancreas_sub <- standard_scop(   pancreas_sub,   linear_reduction = linear_reductions,   nonlinear_reduction = "umap" ) plist1 <- lapply(   linear_reductions, function(lr) {     CellDimPlot(       pancreas_sub,       group.by = "SubCellType",       reduction = paste0(         "Standard", lr, "UMAP2D"       ),       xlab = "", ylab = "", title = lr,       legend.position = "none",       theme_use = "theme_blank"     )   } ) patchwork::wrap_plots(plotlist = plist1)  nonlinear_reductions <- c(   "umap", "tsne", "dm", "phate",   "pacmap", "trimap", "largevis", "fr" ) pancreas_sub <- standard_scop(   pancreas_sub,   linear_reduction = "pca",   nonlinear_reduction = nonlinear_reductions ) plist2 <- lapply(   nonlinear_reductions, function(nr) {     CellDimPlot(       pancreas_sub,       group.by = "SubCellType",       reduction = paste0(         "Standardpca", toupper(nr), "2D"       ),       xlab = "", ylab = "", title = nr,       legend.position = "none",       theme_use = "theme_blank"     )   } ) patchwork::wrap_plots(plotlist = plist2) } # }

title: scop 0.7.0
text: PrepareEnv(): Integrated uv primary Python package installer improved installation speed. check_python(): Now uses uv primary installation tool pip fallback, significantly improving package installation speed. Added find_uv() install_uv() internal functions managing uv package manager installation detection.

title: scop 0.6.6
text: Standardized return value tags: Changed @returns @return consistency. Unified parameter documentation: Replaced \code{value} Markdown backticks `value` format. Standardized default value descriptions. Added @md tags: Added @md tags functions using Markdown syntax documentation. Enhanced cross-references: Added @seealso links related functions appropriate.

title: scop 0.6.5
text: Added comprehensive environment variable configuration prevent crashes calling Python functions, including setting thread limits OMP, OPENBLAS, MKL, NUMBA, libraries. improves stability platforms, especially Apple silicon Macs. Added accept_conda_tos() function automatically accept conda Terms Service required channels, improving conda environment setup process. Fixed conda Terms Service acceptance issue PrepareEnv(). function now automatically accepts conda Terms Service required channels, eliminating need manual acceptance. addresses issue reported #85. Multiple Python-based functions (RunPAGA, RunSCVELO, RunPalantir, RunCellRank, RunWOT, RunPHATE, RunPaCMAP, RunTriMap): Enhanced message formatting code improvements. PrepareSCExplorer(): Fixed package version dependency issues shiny bslib compatibility. function now properly handles bslib theme configuration work shiny 1.6.0 1.7.0+, addressing compatibility errors reported #87. Improved code formatting consistency across multiple functions. Enhanced Python functions inst/python/functions.py better error handling message formatting. Updated documentation multiple functions reflect code improvements.

title: scop 0.6.2
text: CellChatPlot(): Adjusted size saved figures better file size optimization. Updated README.md remove references Monocle2 Monocle3 (deprecated functions).

title: scop 0.6.1
text: PrepareEnv(): Improved message formatting simplified log output better user experience. Added get_conda_envs_dir() helper function centralize conda environment directory retrieval. integration_scop(): Enhanced integration_method parameter definition explicit method list better code clarity. Moved exist_python_pkgs() function check_package.R better code organization. Replaced direct conda_info()$envs_dirs[1] calls get_conda_envs_dir() helper function consistency. RunSCExplorer(): Updated use thisplot::palette_list thisplot::slim_data() instead scop::palette_list scop::slim_data(). Added thisplot dependency checks RunSCExplorer(). Updated documentation across multiple functions.

title: scop 0.6.0
text: PrepareEnv(): Enhanced environment caching mechanism avoid redundant environment preparation. Improved message formatting error handling. Python-based functions (RunPAGA(), RunSCVELO(), RunPalantir(), RunCellRank(), RunWOT()) now automatically call PrepareEnv() internally, eliminating need users manually prepare Python environment using functions. cluster_within_group2(): New function clustering within groups. Multiple plotting functions: Replaced geom_sankey() ggsankey::geom_sankey() better Sankey diagram support. Multiple functions: Replaced ::: operator get_namespace_fun() safer namespace access. Removed RunMonocle() function related documentation (RunMonocle2.Rd, RunMonocle3.Rd). Removed projection_functions.R file (functions moved locations). Replaced custom theme functions thisplot::theme_this() (exported theme_scop()). Replaced direct log_message() calls thisutils::log_message() consistency. Removed palette_list data object. Moved cli Suggests Imports better message formatting support. Added thisplot Imports theme utility functions. Added ggsankey Suggests Sankey diagram support. Added remote dependencies: theislab/destiny, mengxu98/thisplot. Removed unused dependencies: Biobase, BiocGenerics, concaveman, DDRTree, glmGamPoi, hexbin, monocle, png, ragg, tidyr. Updated documentation across multiple functions reflect code refactoring. Improved code organization maintainability.

title: scop 0.5.5
text: Fixed VelocityPlot() function error plot_type = "grid" mode: replaced vectorized arrow length fixed-length arrows (using mean length) resolve vapply() error occurred grid::arrow() received vector instead single value, see #72, #74.

title: scop 0.5.4
text: Fixed parameter name error CheckDataType() function calls: changed data parameter object RunKNNMap(), RunSymphonyMap(), RunScmap(), RunPCAMap(), RunSingleR() functions, see #68. Fixed SingleCellExperiment object creation RunScmap() RunSingleR() functions: changed coercing SummarizedExperiment directly constructing SingleCellExperiment objects.

title: scop 0.5.3
text: PrepareDB(): Changed default Ensembl_version parameter 103 NULL flexible version handling. Added Python version log_message() Python-based functions (RunSCVELO(), RunPAGA(), RunPalantir(), RunCellRank(), RunWOT()) added verbose parameter inheritance improved message formatting using cli-style formatting. Delete harmonizomeapi.py file. Move scop_analysis.py single functions.py file inst/python/ better code organization maintainability. Improved parameter documentation consistency.

title: scop 0.5.1
text: Improved reference formatting consistency across multiple functions. Enhanced documentation clarity readability.

title: scop 0.5.0
text: RunCellChat(): New function perform CellChat analysis investigating cell--cell communication support human, mouse, zebrafish species. CellChatPlot(): New function visualize CellChat analysis results various plot types customization options. Multiple integration functions: Improved error messages message formatting better user experience. Added CellChat package dependency remote repository jinworks/CellChat. Updated README.md improved code formatting examples. Enhanced documentation cell communication analysis functions. Improved error messages user guidance across integration functions. Removed example figures optimize package installation size.

title: scop 0.4.0
text: RunProportionTest(): New function perform Monte-carlo permutation test quantifying cell proportion differences conditions. ProportionTestPlot(): New function generate proportion test plots customizable significance thresholds visualization options. Multiple Python-based functions: add \dontrun{} blocks Github workfolw checking. Added comprehensive documentation new proportion testing functions. Enhanced example documentation across multiple functions. Updated package documentation examples.

title: scop 0.3.4
text: Updated workflow examples function documentation.

title: scop 0.3.3
text: Multiple functions: Improved parameter documentation formatting consistency across package.

title: scop 0.3.2
text: GetFeaturesData() AddFeaturesData(): Enhanced argument clarity, added input validation, standardized return values Seurat, Assay, Assay5 objects. Renamed parameters: query_cell_annotation → query_annotation, ref_cell_annotation → ref_annotation. Improved error message formatting using cli-style formatting. Simplified variable assignments improved readability. Comprehensive documentation updates across multiple functions including AnnotateFeatures, CellDimPlot, CellStatPlot, FeatureStatPlot, GroupHeatmap, RunCellQC, others. Improved parameter descriptions function clarity.

title: scop 0.3.1
text: EnrichmentPlot() GSEAPlot(): Removed conditional font face styling (face = ifelse() logic) better text rendering consistency. Set default value lineheight 0.5 0.7. Updated check_r() function improved package checking functionality. Updated reexports functionality. Updated documentation formatting consistency.

title: scop 0.3.0
text: Fixed segmentation faults R crashes M-series MacBook running Python functions. RunPAGA(): Enhanced M-series MacBook detection automatic environment configuration. RunSCVELO(): Added ARM64-specific optimizations prevent crashes ensure stable execution. RunCellRank(): Implemented M-series compatibility proper NUMBA configuration. RunPalantir(): Added ARM64 support single-threaded execution mode. RunWOT(): Enhanced M-series MacBook environment variable settings. RunTriMap(): Added M-series MacBook compatibility dimensionality reduction. RunPaCMAP(): Implemented ARM64-specific environment configuration. RunPHATE(): Added M-series MacBook support non-linear dimensionality reduction. RunCellQC(): Enhanced scrublet doubletdetection functions ARM64 compatibility. Updated function documentation reflect M-series MacBook compatibility. Added technical notes ARM64 architecture considerations.

title: scop 0.2.9
text: Fix bug RunSCVELO(). Updated documentation functions.

title: scop 0.2.7
text: Added internal function .check_pkg_status() check R package installed. Update function CheckDataType() S4 class function. Update function standard_scop(), make efficient. Delete lifemap data, including: lifemap_cell, lifemap_compartment lifemap_organ. Reconstructed sample data panc8_sub pancreas_sub, retaining basic Seurat object.

title: scop 0.2.6
text: Added remove_r() function easy remove R packages. Rename function: RemovePackages() remove_python(). Removed methods installing R packages check_r() function, retaining pak::pak. Delete useless import packages: BBmisc, BiocManager, covr, devtools, promises withr. Optimize structure _pkgdown.yml file. Updated documentation functions.

title: scop 0.2.0
text: Added remove_python() function easy remove Python packages. Corrected issue py_to_r2() function (intrinsic function), ensures Python-dependent functions like RunPAGA() RunSCVELO() function run correctly.

title: scop 0.1.9
text: Update CellScoring() AddModuleScore2() functions. Now, new parameters cores verbose added. AddModuleScore2() function longer uses BiocParallel::bpparam() function enable parallelization, thisutils::parallelize_fun, cores parameter used control number cores thisutils::parallelize_fun.

text: Fix error RunPalantir() function, see #23.

title: scop 0.1.4
